description: [Daily Maverick] A draft convention against mercenarism is an important milestone in the AU's effort to tackle mercenarism, but success will depend on a strong oversight committee and clear reporting lines.
title: Africa: AU Takes Aim At Africa's New Brand of Mercenaries, but Strong Oversight, Clear Reporting Lines Are Needed

description: [Africa Check] Ignore Facebook video advertising a miracle formula that can cure chronic kidney disease
title: Africa: Ignore Facebook Video Advertising a Miracle Formula That Can Cure Chronic Kidney Disease

description: [Africa CDC] A five-year plan for Tanzania requires a total of $360m for a phased implementation of the Integrated and Coordinated Community Health Workers program to advance the achievement of Universal Health Coverage. The first year alone will cost $40m.
title: Africa: Community Health Plan for Tanzania Needs $360m for Expansion

description: [Africa CDC] The Rwanda Biomedical Center (RBC) has introduced a new set of Event-Based Surveillance (EBS) guidelines designed to enhance the country's public health response amidst the ongoing mpox outbreak.
title: Africa: Rwanda Launches Event-Based Surveillance Guidelines

description: [Africa CDC] A year after the regional meeting held in Burundi in 2023, the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC) continues to advocate for and to review the progress made in the establishment and strengthening of National Public Health Institutes (NPHIs).
title: Africa: Central African Countries Strengthen Effective Response to Health Emergencies

description: [Africa CDC] Upskilling public health laboratory scientists with cutting-edge molecular diagnostic capabilities for rapidly and accurately detecting current and future infectious disease outbreaks is a must, if the continent is to win the battle against outbreaks and health emergencies.
title: Africa: Empowering Africa's Public Health Laboratory Workforce Helps to Advance Outbreak Investigation

description: [New Times] The African Continental Free Trade area (AfCFTA) is one of the flagship projects of AU Agenda 2063. First approved by Heads of State and Government in Addis Ababa in January, 2012, the agreement was signed on March 21, 2018, in Kigali along with the Free Movement Protocol by close to 50 African Union member states.
title: Africa: Africa's Borders Continue to Stifle Its Future

description: [World Bank] Freetown -- Sierra Leone's economy grew by 5.7% in 2023, exceeding expectations, driven by strong performance in the mining sector. However, growth is projected to slow to 4.3% in 2024 due to declining iron ore prices, according to the new World Bank Sierra Leone Economic Update launched today. The report notes a slightly optimistic medium-term outlook, with growth expected to recover to its long-term average of 4.6%, supported by a resurgence in the service sector, improved agricultural productivity, robust mining
title: Africa: Sierra Leone Should Adopt Fiscal Consolidation Measures to Ensure a Sustainable Economic Environment

description: [Daily News] TANZANIA: TANZANIA is increasingly emerging as a top choice for investors worldwide, reflecting the sixth phase government's achievements in enhancing the business environment. The country stands out as a beacon for investors seeking stability and growth in East Africa, leveraging its strategic geographical position and political stability to promise returns on investment.
title: Africa: Why Tanzania Is a Promising Investment Destination in East Africa

description: [New Times] Rwanda visit Benin at the Felix Houphouet-Boigny Stadium in Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire on Friday, October 11, in crunch 2025 Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) Group D qualifier.
title: Africa: Afcon 2025 Qualifiers - Battles That Could Decide Benin, Rwanda Clash

description: [African Arguments] Debating Ideas reflects the values and editorial ethos of the African Arguments book series, publishing engaged, often radical, scholarship, original and activist writing from within the African continent and beyond. It offers debates and engagements, contexts and controversies, and reviews and responses flowing from the African Arguments books. It is edited and managed by the International African Institute, hosted at SOAS University of London, the owners of the book series of the same name.
title: Africa: Did the Tumaini Initiative Exceed Its Mandate?

description: [allAfrica] Lima, Peru -- allAfrica's Sethi Ncube is in Lima, Peru, for the 5th HIV Research for Prevention Conference, HIVR4P 2024, reporting from the only global scientific conference focused on the challenging and fast-growing field of HIV prevention research.
title: Africa: Time to Embrace HIV Prevention Tools While We Wait For The Cure

description: [Mastercard Foundation] THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS CALL FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST
title: Africa: Request For Expression Of Interest: Technical Partner For The Mastercard Foundation Young Africa Works Dialogue Series on Dignified And Fulfilling Work

description: [AI London] Three sub-Saharan African countries on the cusp of abolition must act now and abolish the death penalty once and for all, paving the way for others around the world to follow in their footsteps, said Amnesty International on World Day Against the Death Penalty (10 October).
title: Africa: Africa - Countries On the Cusp of Abolition Must Take a Stand Against the Death Penalty

description: [VOA] Harare, Zimbabwe -- The international human rights organization Amnesty International says three sub-Saharan African countries considering ending the death penalty should do it now and pave the way for others around the world to follow in their footsteps.
title: Africa: Three African Countries On Cusp of Death Penalty Abolition

description: [VOA] Addis Ababa, Ethiopia -- The head of the U.N. International Organization for Migration, or IOM, is calling for safe migration to and from the Gulf countries as the dangerous eastern Horn of Africa route claims more lives.
title: Africa: UN Calls for Safer Migration From Horn of Africa to Gulf Countries

description: [AI London] Executions more than tripled in 2023, while death sentences increased by 66% in the region
title: Africa: Sub-Saharan Africa - Sharp Rise in Use of Death Penalty Across Region

description: [The Conversation Africa] Elephant numbers are surging in southern Africa, with fewer natural predators, reduced hunting pressure and feeding by farmers and tourist operators.
title: Africa: How Do You Stop Elephant Herds From Trashing Crops and Trees? Target Sensitive Nostrils With a 'Scent Fence'

description: [Africa CDC] Addis Ababa, Ethiopia -- This World Mental Health Day, United for Global Mental Health, Africa CDC, the International Council of Nurses (ICN), and the International Federation of Medical Students' Associations (IFMSA) are launching a global campaign to call for more global attention on the mental health needs of health workers worldwide.
title: Africa: Global Campaign Launched to Prioritise the Mental Health of Health Professionals On World Mental Health Day
